title: Digitalization and Artificial Intelligence in Central Asia: Governmental Responses and Further Implications
analysis_techniques: Thematic analysis; Delphi method; Expert interviews
research_description: This article explores the digitalization policies of five Central Asian countries, evaluating their approaches to AI development. It identifies key challenges such as the digital divide, lack of infrastructure, and insufficient government support, while assessing regional cooperation opportunities.
research_results: The research highlights significant challenges, including a digital gap, lack of qualified professionals, and weak legislative frameworks. However, it also identifies potential for regional cooperation in digitalization initiatives.
future_research: Future research could focus on strategies to overcome the digital divide and foster regional cooperation in the development of digital infrastructure and AI in Central Asia.
